page.title: 15A WOMAN AT CHEQUERS
page.content: {A WOMAN AT CHEQUERS _ DUNSMORE In 1979, the Conservative party was returned to power in a General Election and its Leader, Mrs Margaret Thatcher, was invited by the Queen to become Britain's first woman P.M. She is now in her second term in this role, having been re_elected with an increased majority. Her father was a grocer in Grantham and the family lived above his shop. Margaret Roberts attended the local High School and won a place at Oxford University where she obtained an Honours Degree in Chemistry and Law. She has been in office during time of great economic difficulty, with world recession, inflation and rising unemployment, but has shown herself a woman of resolut character, not easily diverted from her political aim. Married to Denis Thatched she has a son and a daughter.
